ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Consistent with left temporal lobe pathology; characterized by deficits in dichotic listening (contralateral ear effect) and temporal patterning despite normal peripheral hearing.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left Temporal Astrocytoma (Resected)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Medical history of partial resection at age 10; MRI confirms involvement of mesial left temporal lobe and encephalomalacia.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Basic evaluation of peripheral hearing sensitivity.
Assessment of speech recognition abilities in quiet.
Central auditory test sensitive to interhemispheric and temporal lobe function.
Binaural integration task sensitive to cortical auditory dysfunction.
Test of temporal processing and interhemispheric transfer.
Dichotic speech task to assess central auditory pathway integrity.
Electrophysiological assessment of cortical auditory responses (N1/P2).
Cognitive auditory evoked potential to assess attention and discrimination.
Imaging to visualize structural brain lesions and extent of temporal lobe involvement.
Evaluation of seizure activity and localization of epileptogenic foci.
Assessment of temporal patterning and interhemispheric transfer.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates normal peripheral hearing sensitivity and excellent speech recognition in quiet. However, the central auditory test battery reveals significant deficits consistent with left temporal lobe dysfunction. Key findings include a mild right ear (contralateral) deficit on the Dichotic Rhyme Test, bilateral deficits on Dichotic Digits (worse in the right ear), and severe bilateral deficits on the Duration Patterns Test. Late evoked potentials (N1/P2) show morphology reductions, particularly for left ear stimulation (though comments suggest a contralateral effect). The P300 could not be elicited due to the patient's inability to perform the cognitive task.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally with thresholds of 0-10 dB HL.

tests.name: Dichotic Digits
tests.result_summary: Mild bilateral deficit; right ear (~70%) performance poorer than left ear (~80%).

tests.name: Late auditory evoked potentials
tests.result_summary: Right ear stimulation showed well-defined N1/P2; Left ear stimulation showed smaller, less defined responses (Findings section text). N1 latencies abnormal; P2 latencies normal/borderline.

tests.name: P300
tests.result_summary: Not derivable; patient unable to keep accurate count of rare stimuli due to cognitive/attention deficits.

tests.name: MRI
tests.result_summary: Abnormal gray and white matter in left inferior temporal lobe; encephalomalacia with thin cortical ribbon in mesial left temporal lobe.

tests.name: EEG
tests.result_summary: Abnormal; focal slowing and paroxysmal instability arising from the left anterior and mid temporal regions.

proposed_items: Anterior commissurotomy (surgical intervention for seizure control)
Consideration of alternative medications and further surgery post-procedure
counseling_actions: Explain that hearing sensitivity is normal but central processing of complex sounds is compromised.
Discuss the impact of the temporal lobe lesion on auditory processing and attention.
Clarify that the inability to perform the P300 task reflects cognitive/attention deficits related to the condition.

red_flags_present: History of subdural hematoma from falls

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is being evaluated prior to scheduled anterior commissurotomy for intractable seizures.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor seizure frequency/severity and auditory/cognitive function following anterior commissurotomy.

expected_outcome: Following anterior commissurotomy, the frequency and severity of seizures decreased.
Patient continues to experience 'drop attacks' post-surgery.
Alternative medications and further surgery are being considered.
